heading: Deaths
txt: Mike Royko, American journalist and author (b. 1932)

entities.title: Mike Royko
entities.description: Michael Royko Jr. was an American newspaper columnist from Chicago. Over his 30-year career, he wrote over 7,500 daily columns for the Chicago Daily News, the Chicago Sun-Times, and the Chicago Tribune. A humorist who focused on life in Chicago, he was the winner of the 1972 Pulitzer Prize for commentary.

heading: Deaths
txt: Hal Laycoe, Canadian ice hockey player and coach (b. 1922)

entities.title: Hal Laycoe
entities.description: Harold Richardson Laycoe was a Canadian ice hockey defenceman and coach.

heading: Deaths
txt: Phạm Văn Đồng, Vietnamese lieutenant and politician, 2nd Prime Minister of Vietnam (b. 1906)

entities.title: Phạm Văn Đồng
entities.description: Phạm Văn Đồng was a Vietnamese politician who served as Prime Minister of North Vietnam from 1955 to 1976. He later served as Prime Minister of Vietnam following reunification of North and South Vietnam from 1976 until he retired in 1987 under the rule of Lê Duẩn and Nguyễn Văn Linh. He was considered one of Hồ Chí Minh's closest lieutenants.

entities.title: Prime Minister of Vietnam
entities.description: The prime minister of Vietnam, officially styled Prime Minister of the Government of the Socialist Republic, is the head of government of Vietnam who presides over the meetings of the Central Government. The prime minister directs the work of government members, and may propose deputy prime ministers to the National Assembly.

heading: Deaths
txt: Arthur B. C. Walker, Jr., American physicist and academic (b. 1936)

entities.title: Arthur B. C. Walker, Jr.
entities.description: Arthur Bertram Cuthbert Walker Jr. was an African-American solar physicist and a pioneer of EUV/XUV optics. He is most noted for having developed normal incidence multilayer XUV telescopes to photograph the solar corona. Two of his sounding rocket payloads, the Stanford/MSFC Rocket Spectroheliograph Experiment and the Multi-Spectral Solar Telescope Array, recorded the first full-disk, high-resolut

heading: Deaths
txt: Bob Akin, American race car driver and journalist (b. 1936)

entities.title: Bob Akin
entities.description: Robert Macomber "Bob" Akin, III was an American business executive, journalist, television commentator and champion sports car racing driver.

heading: Deaths
txt: Janko Bobetko, Croatian Army general and Chief of the General Staff (b. 1919)

entities.title: Janko Bobetko
entities.description: Janko Bobetko was a Croatian general who had participated in World War II and later in the Croatian War of Independence. He was one of the founding members of 1st Sisak Partisan Detachment, the first anti-fascist military unit during World War II in Yugoslavia. He later had a military career in the Yugoslav People's Army (JNA).

heading: Deaths
txt: Sid Smith, Canadian ice hockey player and coach (b. 1925)

entities.title: Sid Smith (ice hockey)
entities.description: Sidney James Smith was a National Hockey League left winger who played with the Toronto Maple Leafs for 12 seasons. He was the Leafs team captain from 1955 to 1956.

heading: Deaths
txt: William J. Bell, American screenwriter and producer (b. 1927)

entities.title: William J. Bell
entities.description: William Joseph Bell was an American screenwriter and television producer, best known as the creator of the soap operas Another World, The Young and the Restless and The Bold and the Beautiful.

txt: Louis Leithold, American mathematician and academic (b. 1924)

heading: Deaths
txt: John Kenneth Galbraith, Canadian-American economist and diplomat, United States Ambassador to India (b. 1908)

entities.title: John Kenneth Galbraith
entities.description: John Kenneth Galbraith, also known as Ken Galbraith, was a Canadian-American economist, diplomat, public official and intellectual. A leading proponent of 20th-century American liberalism, his books on economic topics were bestsellers from the 1950s through the 2000s. As an economist, he leaned toward post-Keynesian economics from an institutionalist perspective.

entities.title: United States Ambassador to India
entities.description: The United States Ambassador to India is the chief diplomatic representative of United States in India. The U.S. Ambassador's office is situated at the U.S. Embassy in New Delhi.

txt: Milt Bocek, American baseball player and soldier (b. 1912)

entities.title: Milt Bocek
entities.description: Milton Francis Bocek was a professional baseball outfielder. He played parts of two seasons for the Chicago White Sox of Major League Baseball (MLB). During his playing career, he was listed at 6 feet 1 inch (1.85 m) and 185 pounds (84 kg).

heading: Deaths
txt: Chuck Daigh, American race car driver (b. 1923)

entities.title: Chuck Daigh
entities.description: Chuck Daigh was an American racing car driver. He broke into Grand Prix racing through Lance Reventlow's Scarab team, through the virtue of being one of the resident engineers. Born in Long Beach, California, he participated in six World Championship Formula One races, debuting on May 29, 1960 and scoring no championship points. He also participated in one non-Championship Formula One race.

heading: Deaths

entities.title: Siamak Pourzand
entities.description: Siamak Pourzand was an Iranian journalist and film critic. He was the manager of the Majmue-ye Farhangi-Honari-ye Tehran—a cultural center for writers, artists, and intellectuals—and wrote cultural commentary for several reformist newspapers later shut down by the Iranian government. heading: Deaths
txt: Shukri Ghanem, Libyan politician, Prime Minister of Libya (b. 1942)

entities.title: Shukri Ghanem
entities.description: Shukri Mohammed Ghanem was a Libyan politician who was the General Secretary of the General People's Committee of Libya from June 2003 until March 2006 when, in the first major government re-shuffle in over a decade, he was replaced by his deputy, Baghdadi Mahmudi. Ghanem subsequently served as the Minister of Oil until 2011. On 29 April 2012, his body was found floating on the New Danube, Vienna.

The ministry was originally called Ministry of Agriculture, but in 1992 the title was changed to its current form. The Development Ministry, which oversaw rural development, was abolished in 1974.

heading: Deaths

entities.title: Renato Corona
entities.description: Renato Tirso Antonio Coronado Corona was the 23rd Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Philippines. He served as an Associate Justice after being appointed by President Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo on April 9, 2002 and later as Chief Justice on May 12, 2010 upon the retirement of Chief Justice Reynato Puno.

entities.title: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Philippines
entities.description:
The chief justice of the Philippines presides over the Supreme Court of the Philippines and is the highest judicial officer of the government of the Philippines. 
As of April 5, 2021, the position is currently held by Alexander Gesmundo, who was appointed by President Rodrigo Duterte following the early retirement of his predecessor Diosdado Peralta in March 2021.
